- Seeing strange, shadowy figures that no one else seems to notice
- Hearing voices that whisper your name when you're alone
- Feeling paranoid, convinced that people are plotting against you
- Becoming increasingly restless and agitated, pacing around your room
- Occasionally shouting or acting aggressively without clear reason
THESE SYMPTOMS CAME INTO FRUITION:
They started suddenly about three days ago, after you binged on synthetic cathinones like mephedrone at a party. You remember feeling intensely paranoid and anxious the next morning, but the hallucinations and agitation have worsened each day since. You’re convinced that others are spying on you or trying to harm you, and you can’t shake the feeling of being watched. Your behavior has become disorganized and unpredictable, and you’re worried you might hurt yourself or someone else if this continues.
